summary: This document consists of daily lieutenant's logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York for August 13-14, 2019. It details routine prison operations, inmate counts, movements, disciplinary actions, and includes a note about an inmate on psychological observation with a companion. The logs show standard administrative procedures during the period shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: Inmates Placed in Administrative Detention
events.description: Inmates Outlaw, Gonzalez, and Ramos were placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) for disciplinary reasons including introduction of contraband, destroying property, and possession of a cellphone.

events.title: Fight and Subsequent Investigations
events.description: A body alarm was activated in 5 North due to a fight at 9:25 PM. Three inmates (Nicholas, Brown, Acosta) were placed in Administrative Detention pending SIS (Special Investigative Services) investigation.

events.title: New Commit on Suicide Watch
events.description: A new inmate commitment (Reg #85431-054) was placed on Suicide Watch after stating he wanted to harm himself.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The logs cover August 13-14, 2019, which is the period immediately preceding Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019. This suggests these are routine logs from after his death.
An inmate with registration number #71230-054 is consistently noted as being 'on Psych Obs w/inmate companion' across multiple shifts. This inmate is not named in these excerpts.
Standard prison operations are documented, including counts, inmate movements to/from court, new commitments, releases, and disciplinary actions.
A fight occurred on the evening of August 14, leading to three inmates being placed in Administrative Detention pending an SIS investigation.
The logs indicate systemic issues such as a malfunctioning public address system preventing PREA announcements and an inoperable fire alarm/pump system.
